head.citation-title: Fusion of electroencephalograms at different channels and different activities via multivariate quaternion valued singular spectrum analysis for intellectual and developmental disorder recognition
head.abstracts: © 2022 Elsevier LtdThis paper proposes a multivariate quaternion valued singular spectrum analysis (MQSSA) for fusing the electroencephalograms (EEGs) at four different channels acquired at two different states (the rest state and listening the smooth music state) together for performing the intellectual and developmental disorder (IDD) recognition. Here, the typical development control (TDC) is used as the control for performing the IDD recognition. First, the multivariate quaternion valued EEGs are formed using the four channel EEGs acquired at two different states. Then, the correlation coefficients between the various parts of the various rows of the MQSSA components and the various channels of the EEG acquired at the various states are computed. As the sum of these correlation coefficients reflect the similarity between the EEG and the MQSSA components, the MQSSA components are selected based on the sum of these correlation coefficients. Next, the features are extracted from the reconstructed EEGs. Finally, three classifiers are employed for performing the recognition. They are the support vector machine (SVM), the k nearest neighbor (kNN) and the random forest (RF). The computer numerical simulation results show that our proposed method does not only perform the fusion of the EEGs from four different channels acquired at two different states effectively, it also yields the high accuracy of the IDD recognition compared to the other EEG fusion methods and the methods without performing the fusion.

author-keyword.$: Multivariate quaternion valued singular spectrum analysis

classification.classification-description: Computer Software, Data Handling and Applications
Combinatorial Mathematics, Includes Graph Theory, Set Theory

coredata.dc:description: This paper proposes a multivariate quaternion valued singular spectrum analysis (MQSSA) for fusing the electroencephalograms (EEGs) at four different channels acquired at two different states (the rest state and listening the smooth music state) together for performing the intellectual and developmental disorder (IDD) recognition. Here, the typical development control (TDC) is used as the control for performing the IDD recognition. First, the multivariate quaternion valued EEGs are formed using the four channel EEGs acquired at two different states. Then, the correlation coefficients between the various parts of the various rows of the MQSSA components and the various channels of the EEG acquired at the various states are computed. As the sum of these correlation coefficients reflect the similarity between the EEG and the MQSSA components, the MQSSA components are selected based on the sum of these correlation coefficients. Next, the features are extracted from the reconstructed EEGs. Finally, three classifiers are employed for performing the recognition. They are the support vector machine (SVM), the k nearest neighbor (kNN) and the random forest (RF). The computer numerical simulation results show that our proposed method does not only perform the fusion of the EEGs from four different channels acquired at two different states effectively, it also yields the high accuracy of the IDD recognition compared to the other EEG fusion methods and the methods without performing the fusion.
coredata.dc:title: Fusion of electroencephalograms at different channels and different activities via multivariate quaternion valued singular spectrum analysis for intellectual and developmental disorder recognition
